data.title: Debug pointer should not highlight blank line while debugging (with F10).
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch VSCode and open a folder which contains .ts project.
2. Set configuration for launch.json (sourceMaps : 'true') and tasks.json.
3. Perform build with CTRL+SHIFT+B and verify app.js is generated.
4. Now set break point to app.ts and start debugging.
5. Keep debugging with F10 and verify debug pointer.

Actual: Looks like debug pointer is not referring latest code and highlighting the blank line while debugging.
Expected: Debugger should not highlight the blank line.

You can refer the sample project from : v-pavanp/ForTestingCode@ 551ea09 

![debugpointer issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14631231/4acce49a-05c7-11e6-9e2d-29c58b25043e.gif)

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Linux Mint 17.3 cinnamon 64-bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. I use key binding Ctrl+Shift+A or Ctrl+}
2. The result is that on HTML the comment line looks like this:

![captura de pantalla de 2016-04-18 22 36 46](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11011637/14627021/142816e6-05b6-11e6-8be1-82480bd2803e.png)

As you can see the coment line is {# my comment#} instead <!-- my comment -->
How can I resolve this problem in HTML? (in the other languages works fine)

data.title: Text selection performance is poor on 1.0 alpha
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-alpha
- OS Version:Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open vscode-docs vnext branch in VS Code and open the vMarch.md file.
2. Go to the Downloads: section which has 8 links for the various VS Code platform flavors.
3. Select some text with the mouse from the first line.  - seems fine
4. Select some text with the mouse from the last line (ex. 32 bit .rpm link) - really slow.
   Note: default word wrap of 300 characters is set.
   Does not repro on 1.0.0-stable

data.title: Test: Custom terminal launch settings
data.body:
Test plan for #3495 #597
- [x] Windows @bgashler1 
- [x] Ubuntu @joaomoreno 
- [x] Fedora @joaomoreno 
### Windows test case

**Default**
1. Right click a folder in the file explorer and ensure it launches a terminal with the default settings

**COMSPEC environment variable https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/597**
1. Install the [TCC/LE cmd replacement](https://jpsoft.com/tccle-cmd-replacement.html)
2. Set it as the default in the `%COMSPEC%` variable
3. Right click a folder in the file explorer and ensure it launches TCC/LE

**Custom terminal settings**
1. Set powershell as custom terminal in settings; `"terminal.external.windowsExec": "powershell"`
2. Right click a folder in the file explorer and ensure it launches powershell
### Linux test case

**Default**
1. Right click a folder in the file explorer and ensure it launches a terminal with the default settings

**Custom via user settings**
1. Install zsh
2. Set zsh as custom terminal in settings; `"terminal.external.linuxExec": "zsh"`
3. Right click a folder in the file explorer and ensure it launches zsh
### Ubuntu/Debian-specific test case

**Custom via alternatives system**
1. Change default terminal emulator in alternatives system:
   
   ```
   sudo update-alternatives –config x-terminal-emulator
   ```
2. Right click a folder in the file explorer and ensure it launches in the new default terminal

data.title: Support custom terminal launch settings on OS X
data.body: Linux and Windows support was added in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/3495

data.title: adding support for a custom `node path` or setting version with NVM
data.body:
adding support for a custom `node path` or setting version with `NVM`. currently it only works with default alias of `NVM`. since the workspace i'm using it would be a hassle every time to change the default alias of `NVM` for every project.
- VSCode Version:
  1.0.0
- OS Version:
  OS X 10.10.5

data.title: OnClick event on Gutter

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
How could I handle `OnClick` events on _Gutter_, similar to how _breakpoints_ does?

The intention was to connect it with a _decorator_ (previously created with `vscode.window.createTextEditorDecorationType`) so the user should _Click_ on the Gutter and create/destroy the decorator assigned to the line where the user clicked.

Thanks in advance

data.title: Message service should show a little more

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When you use `vscode.window.showErrorMessage` (_Information_ and _Warning_ too), the message that is displayed is _limited_ to one line with a certain length. 

It would be good to have a way to _expand_ the message (maybe like the _Read more_ available in Intellisense), showing the entire content.

Thanks in advance

data.title: Suggestion: Nightly builds or way to produce own build
data.body:
To help contributing - we, contributors, need to have a way to get the latest builds. Will be good to have an option, something like `"update.channel": "nightly"`.
If this is not possible - at least have a way to build own VSCode package, which we can use for development.

data.title: No intellisense when object definition and declaration is splitted
